titles.title: To authorize the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to lease, jointly-develop, or otherwise use a commercially provided inflatable habitation module for the International Space Station.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Science.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Space and Aeronautics.

bill.summary: 9/14/2000--Introduced. Authorizes the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) to lease, jointly-develop, or otherwise use a commercially provided inflatable habitation module for the International Space Station, but only if such module would: (1) result in no increase in NASA's planned remaining cost to complete and attach the baseline habitation module; (2) impose no delays to the Space Station Assembly Sequence; and (3) result in no increased safety risk.
